required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Investigate the Safety and Efficacy of Elsubrutinib and Upadacitinib Given Alone or in Combination in Participants With Moderately to Severely Active Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2 Study to Investigate the Safety and Efficacy of Elsubrutinib and Upadacitinib Given Alone or in Combination (ABBV-599 Combination) in Subjects With Moderately to Severely Active Systemic Lupus Erythematosus

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of elsubrutinib, upadacitinib, and ABBV-599 vs placebo for the treatment of signs and symptoms of Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) in participants with moderately to severely active SLE and to define doses for further development.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: SLE Responder Index (SRI)-4 and steroid dose <= 10 mg prednisone equivalent QD
primary_outcome.description: SLE Responder Index (SRI)-4 is defined as >= 4-point reduction in Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Disease Activity Index 2000 (SLEDAI-2K) score without worsening of the overall condition (no worsening in Physician's Global Assessment (PhGA), < 0.3 point increase) or the development of significant disease activity in new organ systems (no new British Isles Lupus Assessment Group [BILAG] A or > 1 new BILAG B).

secondary_outcome.measure: SLE Responder Index (SRI)-4
secondary_outcome.description: SRI is a composite responder index based on improvement in disease activity without worsening of the overall condition or the development of significant disease activity in new organ systems.

secondary_outcome.measure: SLE Responder Index (SRI)-5
secondary_outcome.description: SRI is a composite responder index based on improvement in disease activity without worsening of the overall condition or the development of significant disease activity in new organ systems.

secondary_outcome.measure: SLE Responder Index (SRI)-6
secondary_outcome.description: SRI is a composite responder index based on improvement in disease activity without worsening of the overall condition or the development of significant disease activity in new organ systems.

secondary_outcome.measure: SLE Responder Index (SRI)-7
secondary_outcome.description: SRI is a composite responder index based on improvement in disease activity without worsening of the overall condition or the development of significant disease activity in new organ systems.

secondary_outcome.measure: SLE Responder Index (SRI)-8
secondary_outcome.description: SRI is a composite responder index based on improvement in disease activity without worsening of the overall condition or the development of significant disease activity in new organ systems.

secondary_outcome.measure: British Isles Lupus Assessment Group (BILAG) Based Combined Lupus Assessment (BICLA)
secondary_outcome.description: BICLA is a composite responder index based on improvement in organ systems without worsening of the overall condition and improvement in disease activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lupus Low Disease Activity State (LLDAS)
secondary_outcome.description: LLDAS is a state of low disease activity based on SLEDAI score, absence of SLE disease activity in major organ systems and new disease activity, Physician's Global Assessment, and concomitant medication usage. SLEDAI is the SLE disease activity index focuses on high-impact disease manifestations across organ systems. Scores range from 0 to 105, with higher scores indicating more severe disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving >=4 Point Decrease in Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Disease Activity Index (SLEDAI)-2000 (2K) from Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: SLEDAI-2K is a global SLE disease activity index that focuses on high-impact disease manifestations across the organ systems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Steroid Burden from Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Steroid Burden is measured as milligrams (mg) of daily prednisolone administered.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of flares by Safety of Estrogens in Lupus Erythematosus National Assessment (SELENA) SLEDAI flare index
secondary_outcome.description: SELENA SLEDAI flare index defines SLE flares using the SLEDAI-2K score, disease activity scenarios, treatment changes, and Physician's Global Assessment of Disease Activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to first flare by SELENA SLEDAI flare index after first study drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: SELENA SLEDAI flare index defines SLE flares using the SLEDAI-2K score, disease activity scenarios, treatment changes, and Physician's Global Assessment of Disease Activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieve 50% Reduction of Number of Tender or Swollen Lupus joints (Among Those Starting With Total >=6 Affected Joints)
secondary_outcome.description: Achievement of 50% reduction in number of tender or swollen lupus joints of those starting with >= 6 affected joints as assessed by physical examination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieve 50% Reduction in Cutaneous Lupus Erythematosus Disease Area and Severity Index (CLASI) Activity Score (Of Those Starting With CLASI >=10)
secondary_outcome.description: CLASI is an index used to assess cutaneous manifestations of SLE summarizing the activity of the disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Disease Activity Index (SLEDAI)-2000 (2K) from Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: SLEDAI-2K is global SLE disease activity index that focuses on high-impact disease manifestations across the organ systems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in British Isles Lupus Assessment Group (BILAG) from Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: BILAG is a global SLE disease activity index designed on the basis of the physician's intention to treat, focusing on changes in disease manifestations.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Physician's Global Assessment from Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's overall disease activity due to SLE, as compared with all possible patients with SLE as assessed by physician.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Patient Global Assessment (PtGA) from Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The PtGA is a single-item assessment in which participants are asked to rate the overall effect that lupus has on them at the time the assessment is completed. The PtGA is a visual analog scale with scores ranging from 0 to 100 and high scores indicating greater disease activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy - fatigue (FACIT-F) from Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: FACIT-F is a patient-reported questionnaire developed to assess fatigue. The responses to the items on the FACIT-F questionnaire are each measured on a 4-point Likert scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Short Form (SF)-36 from Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: SF-36 is a general Health Related Quality of Life (HRQoL) instrument which comprises 36 total questions targeting participant's functional health and well-being.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change Lupus Quality of Life (LupusQoL) from Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The Lupus Quality of Life (LupusQoL) is a disease-specific Health Related Quality of Life (HRQoL) patient reported outcome (PRO) instrument.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Pain Numerical Rating Scale (NRS) from Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The pain NRS scale is a single item questionnaire in which participants are asked to rate the overall pain level. The pain NRS scores range from 0 to 10, with higher scores indicating a higher level of pain.

arm_group.description: Participants will be administered with elsubrutinib dose A and upadacitinib dose A.
Participants will be administered with elsubrutinib dose A and upadacitinib dose B.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group 3: Elsubrutinib and Placebo for Updadacitinib
arm_group.description: Participants will be administered with elsubrutinib dose A and placebo for upadacitinib.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group 4: Upadacitinib and Placebo for Elsubrutinib
arm_group.description: Participants will be administered with placebo for elsubrutinib and upadacitinib dose A.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group 5: Placebo for Elsubrutinib and Placebo for Upadacitinib
arm_group.description: Participants will be administered with placebo for elsubrutinib and placebo for upadacitinib.

intervention.arm_group_label: Group 3: Elsubrutinib and Placebo for Updadacitinib
Group 4: Upadacitinib and Placebo for Elsubrutinib
Group 5: Placebo for Elsubrutinib and Placebo for Upadacitinib
Group 4: Upadacitinib and Placebo for Elsubrutinib
Group 3: Elsubrutinib and Placebo for Updadacitinib
Group 5: Placebo for Elsubrutinib and Placebo for Upadacitinib

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participant has clinical diagnosis of SLE at least 24 weeks prior to screening, meeting at least 4 of the 11 revised Criteria for Classification of SLE according to the 1997 Update of the 1982 American College of Rheumatology (ACR) OR meeting at least 4 of the 2012 SLICC classification criteria, including at least 1 clinical criterion and 1 immunologic criterion.
- At Screening, must have at least one of the following:
- antinuclear antibody(ANA)+ (titer >= 1:80).
- anti-dsDNA+.
- anti-Smith+.
- SLEDAI-2K >= 6 despite background therapy as reported and independently adjudicated (clinical score >= 4, excluding lupus headache and/or organic brain syndrome) at Screening.
- If 4 points of the required entry points are for arthritis, there must also be a minimum of 3 tender and 3 swollen joints.
- If participant has rash and PI considers it to be attributable to SLE, participant must consent to skin photograph collection for adjudication.
- Score must be re-confirmed at the Baseline visit.
- Physician's Global Assessment (PhGA) >= 1 during screening period.
- Must be on background treatment, stable for 30 days, at Baseline and throughout the study with antimalarial(s), prednisone (or prednisone equivalent) (<=20 mg), azathioprine (<= 150 mg), mycophenolate (<2 g), leflunomide (<=20 mg), cyclosporine, tacrolimus, and/or methotrexate (MTX) (<=20 mg).
- No combinations of the above with immunomodulators other than prednisone (or equivalents) and antimalarials.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant using intravenous (IV) or intramuscular (IM) corticosteroids greater than or equal to a 40 mg prednisone-equivalent bolus within 30 days of planned randomization.

link.description: This clinical study may be evaluating a usage that is not currently FDA approved. Please see US Prescribing Information for approved uses.

patient_data.ipd_description: AbbVie is committed to responsible data sharing regarding the clinical trials we sponsor. This includes access to anonymized, individual and trial-level data (analysis data sets), as well as other information (e.g., protocols and clinical study reports), as long as the trials are not part of an ongoing or planned regulatory submission. This includes requests for clinical trial data for unlicensed products and indications.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data requests can be submitted at any time and the data will be accessible for 12 months, with possible extensions considered.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Access to this clinical trial data can be requested by any qualified researchers who engage in rigorous, independent scientific research, and will be provided following review and approval of a research proposal and Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) and execution of a Data Sharing Agreement (DSA). For more information on the process, or to submit a request, visit the following link.
